availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis "Frank" Madden (Jefferson Co, Ky, bookstore owner and quartermaster, 15th KY (U.S.A.))

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, book store owner. Brooklyn, New York, native. Married to Anne L. McKenzie Madden in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on December 25, 1849. Father of Julia Madden, Edward F. Madden, Eva A Madden. Bookbinder in Louisville in 1850. Book store owner in Louisville in 1860. Employed Catherine Henderson in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
"Pioneer Resident of Jefferson County Dies," Louisville Courier Journal, 5 Dec 1910, 3 (accessed via ProQuest Historical Newspapers).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 3, p. 299A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. X
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 143B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482707, p. 18.
